Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, smudged in places, and containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.146)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87662) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87662)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 182 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
